00039     /*tree variables*/
00040     struct EventTracks
00041     {
00042       int       NTracks;
00043       
00044       double    EmcEnergy;
00045       double    AhcEnergy;
00046       double    TcmtEnergy;
00047 
00048       std::vector< int >        t_NHits;
00049       std::vector< int >        t_NLength;
00050       std::vector< int >        t_StartLayer;
00051       std::vector< int >        t_StopLayer;
00052       std::vector< double >     t_CosPhi;
00053       
00054       /* The following vectors contain actually hit information for each track
00055          I had to use a flat structure, as ROOT does not support a 2 dim (i.e. vector < vector < double > >)
00056          without having to create a dictionary, which i want do avoid.
00057          Hence: The t_h_xxx variables contain the hit information for all tracks stripped together,
00058          and the t_trackHitIndex saves the position of the first hit of each track within these t_h_xxx vars */
00059       std::vector< int >        t_trackHitIndex;
00060       std::vector< double >     t_h_Energy;
00061       std::vector< int >        t_h_I;
00062       std::vector< int >        t_h_J;
00063       std::vector< int >        t_h_K;
00064       
00065     } _event;
00066     
00067     
00068   };
